jobs.title: Principal Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
What do we do?

Paddle offers digital product companies a completely different approach to their payment infrastructure. Instead of assembling and maintaining a complex stack of payments-related apps and services, we’re a Merchant of Record for our customers. That means we take away 100% of the pain of payment fragmentation. It’s faster, safer, cheaper, and, above all, way better.

We’re backed by investors including KKR, FTV Capital, Kindred, Notion, and 83North and serve over 5000 software sellers in 245 territories globally.

The Role:

We’re hiring a Principal Engineer to drive Paddle’s company-wide technical vision for our platform and backend architecture. Reporting to the Senior Director of Engineering, you’ll act as the technical authority for foundational architectural decisions, leading multi-year, cross-department initiatives that shape how we design, build, and operate highly scalable, reliable, and secure systems.

This role is ideal for someone who blends deep distributed systems expertise with strategic thinking and genuine empathy for our customers. You should have exceptional communication skills and a talent for building strong, collaborative relationships across the business.

What you'll do:

  • Own and articulate the long-term technical vision and architectural strategy for key parts of Paddle’s platform, aligning it with product and company goals.

  • Define durable architectural patterns, interfaces, and platform capabilities that enable multiple teams to build consistently and safely at speed.

  • Initiate and drive large, complex programmes of work that simplify systems, reduce operational risk, and accelerate delivery.

  • Serve as the decision-maker on high-stakes technical choices and architectural trade-offs, ensuring durable, high-quality outcomes.

  • Develop deep product fluency: become an expert in how our product works and how it delivers value to the business, connecting architecture decisions to revenue, margin, risk, and customer experience.

  • Partner with the Product team and other stakeholders to turn ambitious ideas into feasible plans of action.

  • Elevate operational excellence: set patterns that drive teams to be proactive, data-driven, and disciplined in how they manage their systems.

  • Mentor Staff and Senior engineers, grow technical leadership capability across the org, and champion engineering excellence and pragmatic simplicity.

  • Represent Paddle’s technical direction in executive and cross-functional forums, communicating complex concepts with clarity and influence.⁠⁠⁠⁠

We’d love to hear from you if you:

  • Bring deep experience designing and evolving large-scale, distributed backend systems with strong foundations in architecture, performance, reliability, and data integrity.

  • Have a track record of leading company-level technical strategy and delivering multi-quarter, cross-team initiatives with measurable impact.

  • Operate comfortably as an architect, strategist, and problem solver: defining clear architectural direction, connecting technology to business outcomes, and unblocking the hardest technical challenges.

  • Are comfortable collaborating and getting hands-on with code when the situation calls for it.

  • Excel at navigating ambiguity, making sound trade-offs, and simplifying complex systems into maintainable, evolvable designs.

  • Communicate with precision across audiences, from engineers to executives, building alignment and momentum through shared understanding.

  • Champion operational excellence and reliability engineering as first principles, especially in regulated or high-trust domains.

  • Empower and uplift others through mentorship, documentation, and setting high standards for engineering practice.⁠⁠⁠⁠

Impact you’ll have in this role:

  • Define and land architectural patterns and platform strategies that improve developer velocity and product reliability across the company.

  • Proactively identify and mitigate systemic risks, guiding preventative architecture and process changes.

  • Lead transformative programmes that retire complexity, unlock new capabilities, or enable step-change improvements in scale, resilience, or cost efficiency.

  • Shape Paddle’s engineering culture by modelling excellence, rigorous thinking, and inclusive collaboration.⁠⁠

Everyone is welcome at Paddle

At Paddle, we’re committed to removing invisible barriers, both for our customers and within our own teams. We recognise and celebrate that every Paddler is unique and we welcome every individual perspective. As an inclusive employer, we don’t care if, or where, you studied, what you look like or where you’re from. We’re more interested in your craft, curiosity, passion for learning and what you’ll add to our culture. We encourage you to apply even if you don’t match every part of the job ad, especially if you’re part of an underrepresented group.

Please let us know if there’s anything we can do to better support you through the application process and in the workplace. We will do everything we can to support any accommodations needed. We’re committed to building a diverse team where everyone feels safe to be their authentic self. Let’s grow together.


Why you’ll love working at Paddle

We are a diverse, growing group of Paddlers across the globe who pride ourselves on our transparent, collaborative and respectful culture.

We live and breathe our values, which are:

Paddle for others

Paddle together

Paddle simply

We offer a full suite of benefits, including attractive salaries, stock options, retirement plans, private healthcare and well-being initiatives.

We are a ‘digital-first’ company, which means you can work remotely, from one of our stylish hubs, or even a bit of both! We offer all team members unlimited holidays and enhanced parental leave. We invest in learning and will help you with your personal development via constant exposure to new challenges, an annual learning fund, and regular internal and external training.

The Role:  

We're looking for a sharp and strategic Product Marketing Manager - Compete to turn competitive insights into market wins. You’ll lead our Competitor motion end-to-end, from surfacing intelligence to crafting the narratives, plays, and campaigns that help us outmaneuver competitions and claim territory. This isn’t about keeping tabs on the competition. It’s about systematically outplaying them.

You’ll work closely with the wider Product Marketing team, Sales, Revenue Marketing, and Enablement to arm the field and fuel takedown campaigns that convert faster and defend stronger. Your work will directly influence pipeline velocity, win rates, and our ability to own the market conversation.

What you'll own:

Competitive Intelligence & Market Dynamics

  • Build and run a high-impact compete program that track key players and emerging threats

  • Monitor competitor moves across product, pricing, GTM, and narrative. Translating noise into actionable signal

  • Maintain always-on battlecards, teardowns and segment-specific insights that keep us two steps ahead

  • Run competitive debriefs, and brief execs and frontline teams on strategic threats and opportunities

Takedown Campaigns & Offensive Plays

  • Partner with Revenue Marketing to design and launch compete-first campaigns

  • Influence messaging, content, and targeting for competitive switch, win-back, and disrupt plays

  • Create frameworks to scale compete activation across channels, from outbound cadences to demand gen tactics

Win/Loss Analysis & Strategic Insights

  • Build a closed-loop win/loss program to diagnose competitive friction points across the funnel

  • Turn qualitative and quantitative data into strategic insights that inform GTM, positioning, and product roadmap

  • Work with RevOps to track competitive pressure across pipeline and ARR

Enablement & Field Activation

  • Arm GTM Enablement to train Sales, SDRs, CS, and other frontline teams on how to dismantle competitor value props and handle objections with confidence

  • Deliver play-ready narratives that help the team drive urgency, differentiation, and control the conversation

  • Build a compete culture where every team member feels confident going head-to-head

Positioning & Narrative

  • Shape and evolve our positioning to double down on our strengths and expose competitor weaknesses

  • Partner with wider PMM and Brand teams to ensure our messaging lands clean and hard across all GTM touchpoints

  • Influence roadmap decisions by surfacing competitor blind spots and opportunity gaps

We'd love to hear from you:

  • 4+ years in product marketing, competitive intelligence, or GTM strategy roles in high-growth B2B SaaS

  • Proven experience with win/loss analysis, competitor research, and sales enablement

  • Strong storytelling and content creation skills, decks, docs, campaigns, and enablement tools

  • Bias for action: you're curious, commercially savvy, and thrive in fast-paced, high-stakes environments

  • You can balance short-term GTM firepower with long-term strategic insight, and you're not afraid to make bold calls

The Role: 

As Senior Product Designer on our Checkout product at Paddle, you’ll use your full range of skills from problem exploration, user research, running ideation sessions, prototyping, UX/UI design and working closely with the engineering team to make things happen.

Furthermore, you’ll need to think strategically about the future of the product and contribute to the further development of a scalable design system and process. You need to be a holistic problem solver who can look beyond and above pixels and contribute proactively at different levels.

You will sit in the product team who are responsible for making sure we build the best, customer-centred products at Paddle. As a team, we believe in ownership, autonomy and accountability. We work alongside engineering in multi-functional product teams which have a strong product manager and product designer who collaborate to reach the best solution.

What you'll do: 

  • Work closely with our product and engineering teams to further build out the Paddle Checkout platform.

  • Partner with product managers to define and evolve product roadmaps and work closely with engineers as you build, iterate on, and ship ideas.

  • Excel at user interviews and user testing.

  • Design and prototype intuitive user interfaces.

  • Work on building out features that make complex tasks + workflows simple and easy to understand for all levels of customers.

  • You have proven experience working on a high-scale, consumer facing experience such as a Checkout.

  • You have a strong portfolio to demonstrate the end-to-end design process.

  • You have experience collaborating with other product designers, PMs, engineers, and partnering with cross-functional teams across the business.

  • You are able to clearly communicate design work and the rationale behind it and back it up with quantitative and qualitative user research data.

  • You are a self-starter who can work through ambiguity and autonomously complete a task from start to finish with minimal oversight.

You’ll develop high-impact case studies, testimonials, and references, while also building community connections that fuel events, ABM, campaigns, and content. Crucially, you’ll act as a conduit for customer insights, capturing and surfacing key feedback themes from our most engaged customers to influence GTM strategy, messaging, and product development.

  • Demand Gen & ABM: Support targeted campaigns with customer stories and references by vertical, segment, or account tier.

  • Strong storytelling and interview skills with a track record of delivering high-quality customer assets

  • Experience supporting both PLG and sales-led motions with targeted customer content

  • Ability to build relationships with internal teams and external customers alike, personable, thoughtful, and proactive

  • Strong marketing writing skills to turn interviews into compelling narratives, craft high-impact copy, and tailor messages to different personas and funnel stages

What do we do?

Paddle offers digital product companies a completely different approach to their payment infrastructure. Instead of assembling and maintaining a complex stack of payments-related apps and services, we’re a Merchant of Record for our customers. That means we take away 100% of the pain of payment fragmentation. It’s faster, safer, cheaper, and, above all, way better. 

We’re backed by investors including KKR, FTV Capital, Kindred, Notion, and 83North and serve over 5000 software sellers in 245 territories globally. 

The Role:  

We’re hiring a Head of Web to lead Paddle’s most visible and commercially critical digital properties. This role sits at the intersection of brand, performance, and product, and is responsible for transforming Paddle’s digital surfaces into high-performance, high-conversion engines that support our PLG and sales-led growth.

You’ll lead a cross-functional web team (design, dev, UX, content, and experimentation) with full accountability for performance, conversion, velocity of execution, and alignment across teams. This is a dynamic growth function. You’ll use AI to accelerate design, prototyping, and personalisation, ensuring rapid iterations and continuous testing to meet aggressive pipeline and revenue goals.

What you'll do: 

  • Strategy & Roadmap: Define the vision and roadmap for paddle.com and other digital surfaces, balancing brand storytelling, product clarity, conversion, and speed.

  • Performance & Conversion: Own end-to-end performance, from traffic through to key actions (sign-ups, demo requests, pricing page visits, PQL triggers).

  • Design Velocity & Experimentation: Use AI design and prototyping tools to rapidly test and iterate UX, copy, and layouts.

  • PLG & Sales Motion Enablement: Build seamless, distinct journeys for self-serve and sales-led visitors. Optimise CTA strategy, user flows, and intent signalling for each motion.

  • SEO & Organic Growth: Drive cross-functional alignment and ensure SEO is embedded across web, content, and growth initiatives. Partner closely with the SEO Marketing Manager to ensure most effective execution of technical, on-page, and content optimisation, to deliver qualified organic traffic growth and competitive rankings across all ICPs and segments.

  • Content & Messaging: Collaborate with Product Marketing and Brand to ensure copy, messaging, and structure align to ICPs, segments, and commercial priorities.

  • Experimentation & CRO: Build a test-and-learn culture. Implement frameworks for rapid A/B and multivariate testing. Drive continuous improvements to conversion rates.

  • Tech Stack & Site Performance: Lead dev resources to ensure the site is fast, stable, and scalable. Own decisions around CMS, infrastructure, tracking, and tooling.

  • AI-Driven Personalisation: Implement AI-based personalisation frameworks (e.g., content modules, visitor segmentation, journey orchestration) to increase relevance and outcomes.

We'd love to hear from you:

  • 7+ years in web, growth, UX, or digital product roles within B2B SaaS

  • Proven track record owning web performance, conversion optimisation, and experimentation

  • Experience leading cross-functional teams of developers, designers, and UX/content

  • Strong technical acumen and comfortable leading CMS/stack decisions and working closely with engineers

  • Experience using AI design and prototyping tools and personalisation platforms

  • Data-informed, test-driven mindset with fluency in A/B testing, analytics platforms, and session tools

  • Strategic, collaborative, fast-moving, comfortable working across brand, product, and performance

Everyone is welcome at Paddle

At Paddle, we’re committed to removing invisible barriers, both for our customers and within our own teams. We recognise and celebrate that every Paddler is unique and we welcome every individual perspective. As an inclusive employer, we don’t care if, or where, you studied, what you look like or where you’re from. We’re more interested in your craft, curiosity, passion for learning and what you’ll add to our culture. We encourage you to apply even if you don’t match every part of the job ad, especially if you’re part of an underrepresented group.

Please let us know if there’s anything we can do to better support you through the application process and in the workplace. We will do everything we can to support any accommodations needed. We’re committed to building a diverse team where everyone feels safe to be their authentic self. Let’s grow together. 


Why you’ll love working at Paddle

We are a diverse, growing group of Paddlers across the globe who pride ourselves on our transparent, collaborative and respectful culture. 

We live and breathe our values, which are:

Paddle for others

Paddle together

Paddle simply

We offer a full suite of benefits, including attractive salaries, stock options, retirement plans, private healthcare and well-being initiatives. 

We are a ‘digital-first’ company, which means you can work remotely, from one of our stylish  hubs, or even a bit of both! We offer all team members unlimited holidays and enhanced parental leave. We invest in learning and will help you with your personal development via constant exposure to new challenges, an annual learning fund, and regular internal and external training.

  • Extensive experience with classical ML techniques (boosted trees, neural networks, regressions, clustering, etc.).

  • Demonstrated expertise with agentic AI, prompt engineering, and leveraging Large Language Models (e.g. LangChain / Graph).

  • Proficiency in Python and key data science libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).

We’re looking for a Senior GTM Operations Manager to join our GTM Ops team. It’s our job to support, accelerate and optimise the strategic efforts of Sales, Marketing, Finance and Customer Success.

The role will have a focus in core sales operations pillars like commissions, territories and analytics. You’ll also lead projects from conception to delivery, ensuring Paddle is able to scale effectively.   • Implement and maintain standardised processes and workflows across revenue teams.

  • Document and communicate process changes to relevant stakeholders.

  • Ensure data integrity and consistency across all revenue platforms.

  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key revenue metrics.

Our InfoSec and IT teams are looking for a Staff Systems Engineer to lead and innovate at the intersection of infrastructure, security, and automation. This is a hands-on, high-impact role for someone who thrives in a digital-first, collaborative environment and is passionate about building resilient, secure, and scalable systems. You’ll be a technical leader across both our InfoSec and IT teams, driving the evolution of our systems landscape in both our Enterprise IT and Product environments. Your work will empower our global team of Paddlers to operate securely and efficiently, while ensuring that our systems not only meet but exceed industry standards.

What you'll do: 

  • Lead initiatives to automate operational processes, reducing manual effort and increasing reliability, with a focus on scalability and security.

  • Partner with IT and InfoSec leadership to design, implement, and optimise integrations across business-critical IT and security systems, ensuring seamless connectivity and data flow.

  • Champion compliance with industry best practices and security standards, including CIS Benchmarks, and proactively identify areas for improvement.

  • Support GRC initiatives on control implementation, audit evidence gathering and unlocking efficiency improvements through the adoption of automation.

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to deliver projects aligned with the Enterprise Technology roadmap, ensuring measurable impact and timely delivery.

  • Contribute to the secure configuration and monitoring of our AWS cloud infrastructure and working with the Platform team to ensure security initiatives are delivered in a scalable and reliable manner.

  • Mentor and support other engineers across InfoSec, IT and the wider Engineering function, fostering a culture of continuous improvement, knowledge sharing, and technical excellence.

At Paddle we value a growth mindset and a willingness to learn, so if you're confident in most of these skills (not necessarily all) and you're excited to grow, we encourage you to apply.

  • You have extensive experience in one or more of systems engineering, site reliability engineering, security engineering, or software development with a strong track record of hands-on delivery in both IT and security domains.

  • You're comfortable working collaboratively across multiple business functions, and can operate autonomously on high-impact and wide-reaching projects.

  • You can demonstrate strong knowledge of systems integration and automation, with a passion for reducing operational complexity and driving continuous improvement.

  • You're familiar with modern device management, IAM, and EDR solutions (e.g., Okta, Jamf, SentinelOne), as well as collaboration and networking tools (e.g., Google Workspace, Slack, Cisco Meraki, Cloudflare Zero Trust).

  • You have a software engineering background (desirable), with experience in scripting or programming to automate workflows and integrate systems.

  • You can communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders, and are comfortable influencing at all levels of the business.

  • You're passionate about security, automation, and operational excellence, and want to make a real impact at scale.

As Product Compliance & Risk Manager, you’ll be embedded with Paddle’s Product and Commercial teams, acting as a trusted partner on product design, seller flows, and compliance requirements. You’ll ensure Paddle’s products and commercial propositions are compliant by design, translating regulations and scheme rules into clear business requirements and ensure risks are identified and managed in an appropriate manner.

You will also take ownership of remediation of known compliance issues, building policies, guidance, and seller communications that create consistency and reduce risk and be responsible for embedding risk management practices such as RCSAs and control testing, giving the business deeper visibility of control effectiveness.

This role reports to the Compliance & Risk Lead and sits within the Legal & Compliance team, partnering closely with Legal, Sales, Operations, and Product.

 - Provide compliance advisory to Product and Sales on new features, ensuring compliance by design.

 - Own product risk assessments across the development lifecycle, making sure risks are identified, documented, and mitigated before launch.

 - Lead compliance workstreams in product or seller remediation initiatives (e.g. subscription flows, refund policy updates).

 - Draft and maintain policies relevant to product and commercial compliance (subscription/negative option rules, scheme disclosures, seller comms).

 - Support development of seller communications and guidance docs, ensuring requirements are clear and consistent.

 - Manage incidents and issues in the product/commercial domain, escalating high-risk cases to your Lead.

 - Develop and maintain obligation mapping for scheme and product-related requirements, working with Legal to identify applicable regulation.

 - Support regulatory change implementation, embedding new requirements into policies and product controls.

 - Over time, contribute to risk management activities (RCSAs, control testing, documenting control effectiveness).

 - You bring 7+ years’ experience in compliance, risk, or regulatory advisory, ideally in payments, fintech, or SaaS.

 - You have strong expertise in consumer protection, card scheme rules or payments regulation

 - You’re confident in drafting policies, guidance, and compliance frameworks that stand up to regulatory scrutiny.

 - You have run risk assessments on product and commercial initiatives, providing clear recommendations to stakeholders.

 - You have experience in cross-functional project delivery, especially remediation or regulatory change.

 - You’re a strong communicator, able to simplify regulatory requirements for Product, Sales, and senior leadership.

As a member of the Tax team you will be involved in Paddle’s complex and growing tax function. You will report to a regional tax manager and will be responsible for managing complex tax accounting, reporting, and compliance activities across the organization. You’ll be part of a global team, focused on both direct and indirect tax matters.

The ideal candidate is highly autonomous, taking full ownership of tax processes from start to finish, while ensuring thorough review. They will possess a deep technical knowledge in tax law and accounting standards. The candidate will be expected to serve as a technical expert for the broader organization, by providing tax guidance cross-functionally and mentoring team members.

What you'll do: 

[This will depend specifically on the scope of the role needed. However it may include some or all of the following:]

  • Preparation of the indirect tax returns for Paddle entities. This will include dealing with the associated tax filings, payments, accounting entries, and audits.

  • Assist in the preparation of the direct tax returns for Paddle entities. This will include dealing with the associated tax payments and accounting entries.

  • Assist with transfer pricing adjustments, R&D claims, and other tax planning

  • Manage one-off projects e.g. establishment of new corporate infrastructure or registrations, and answer one-off questions for Paddle’s customers.

  • For certain elements of the role the individual will be co-ordinating and working with third party company advisors and agents to ensure delivery of tasks.

  • You have proven experience in a similar role within direct/indirect/mixed tax.

  • You have a recognised professional accounting and or tax qualification..

  • Good knowledge and understanding of the tax environment for multinational groups.

  • You have handled complex, large-dataset Excel and Google spreadsheets in the day-to-day of your previous/current roles.
